intro: Vitex thonneri var. tibatensis, commonly known as the Tibatensis vitex, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. The leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. This species is often found in woodland or scrub habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Vitex genus, though it remains relatively understudied compared to more widespread relatives.
